fields.description: Jira introduces pluggable top navigation, which give us abiliy to promote corporate style. GreenHopper dont use common Decorator and breaks look&feel.
fields.summary: Why not use standart decorator with pluggable Top navigation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I have created some custom statuses for issues, and one of them is not showing up when configuring the task board.

Upon looking at the data in the issuestatus table, I noticed that 2 statuses have the same "sequence" value, and it is one of those that is not showing up in the list.

My test system has these same status, but the statuses do not have the same sequence value.  In test, all the statuses show up correctly.

I will correct the data in my production system, but figured I would report this obscure bug so that it can be fixed in a future release.
fields.summary: Not all status showing up for Task Board configuration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The GH filter / highlight dialog is very limited, and obviously can't be made to encompass everything that a standard Jira search can do with all the fields.

Often people need to filter based on other criteria than those available in the filter. Currently this can only be done by doing a search and then saving it as a filter.

This works for more permanent "filters", but often people want to do this for their current work as well. It would therefor be very handy to have a greenhopper option in the issue navigator that can take you to the planning / task board with the current search.
fields.summary: Ability to filter / highlight based on current issue navigator search

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently there are options only for "component" and "version".

However, for a large team, it would be very useful to also have an "assignee board" (filtered by group so that the assignable list isn't too large), where the assignees are on the right. This would allow for team leads to see how many points each team member has assigned to them at a glance and also quickly reassign tasks by dragging to them.

This is the top requested feature for Jira as a whole by our team.
fields.summary: Ability to have an "assignee" board in the planning board

fields.description:
There's an exception from GreenHopper whenever I run a jelly script that performs a workflow transition an an issue (call it SOURCE-1). This transition triggers the "copy-and-link" function of a custom plugin (created by another company):
- a new issue is created on another project, for example TARGET-1 (this new issue is also properly indexed)
- the new issue TARGET-1 is linked to the source issue SOURCE-1

This "copy-and-link" functionality works fine, but there are exceptions from GreenHopper in the jira log messages. The relevant messages are below. I have posted the detailed log here:
http://pastebin.com/f1a5f707e

Does anyone know what causes these exceptions?
I have already tried removing GreenHopper's "ranking" custom field, but the error messages still appear.

--------
2009-02-20 13:27:27,366 TP-Processor5 ERROR [jira.event.issue.IssueEventDispatcher] Exception thrown from listener [com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.customfields.GreenHopperCTFIndexer] : null
java.lang.NullPointerException
at webwork.action.factory.ApplicationMap.get(ApplicationMap.java:131)
at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.configurations.GeneralConfiguration.load(GeneralConfiguration.java:155)
at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.configurations.GHConfiguration.<init>(GHConfiguration.java:42)
at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.customfields.GreenHopperCTFIndexer.issueCreated(GreenHopperCTFIndexer.java:50)
at com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.AbstractIssueEventListener.workflowEvent(AbstractIssueEventListener.java:110)
at com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.IssueEventDispatcher.dispatchEvent(IssueEventDispatcher.java:125)
at com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.IssueEventDispatcher.dispatchEvent(IssueEventDispatcher.java:89)
at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.event.FireIssueEventFunction.execute(FireIssueEventFunction.java:60)
at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.executeFunction(AbstractWorkflow.java:869)
at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.transitionWorkflow(AbstractWorkflow.java:1265)
at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.initialize(AbstractWorkflow.java:61
at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.SimpleWorkflowManager.createIssue(SimpleWorkflowManager.java:217)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:337)
----------
fields.summary: Exception thrown from GH listener when running Jelly scripts

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have a project with different issue types all of which have a separate Greenhopper Ranking field.  Different people are responsible for ranking the various issue types.  We want to be able to allow only a selected set of people to be able to reder each isue type.  As far as we can tell, it is only posible o give people access to to order on every field or none of the fields.  Is there a way?

*Workaround*

Restrict the possibility to drag and rank your issues in your projects.
The default Permission used is Resolve Issues to be able to drag and rank but you can override this Permission in GreenHopper with the "Schedule Issues". You just need to go into your Project > planning board > Configuration > GENERAL >>> General setup and enable the Need Scheduling Permission.

Doing so your user will need to have the Permission Schedule Issues permission to drag and rank. Thus developers can still resolve issues without being able to drag and rank

Of course you will have to grant your user that can drag and rank with the Schedule Issues
fields.summary: Restricting access to different Greenhopper Ranking fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I am using Greenhopper 3.1 with Jira Studio 1.5.1 with both FireFox 3.0.5 and IE7 (latest service updates)

When working with the Task Board, Planning Board and Chart Board, it is only possible to use one filter for any of these views at one time. If I open multiple browser windows and select a filter from one browser window and then refresh the *other* window, the new filter has been applied in both places. Furthermore, it appears that this happens between my laptop and my PC as well. Changing the filter in IE then refreshing FireFox results in the new filter, too.

It appears that the filter is being stored on the server by user ID, unless I'm missing something terribly obvious.

As a Program Manager on a large project, I would like to have multiple filters open at any one time so that I can view / manage tasks for each without going through the (extremely painfully long) wait for the filter to be applied.

Steps to reproduce:
Start a new FireFox window
Log in to Jira / GreenHopper
Create 2 filters - filter1 and filter2
Open the Planning Board, select filter1
Start a new FireFox window
Access Jira / GreenHopper
Open the Planning Board - note that filter1 is already selected
Change to filter2
Return to original browser window
Refresh page

Expected result:
Original window would still have the same filter applied

Actual result:
Original window's filter has been changed
fields.summary: Only one filter can be active at one time

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We recommend the Outline view as the preferred view on the Task Board but it is becomes confusing if you apply a filter that prevents the display of the parent task. The most common occurrence of this in out usage is the "Assigned to Me" filter. Our Stories are all assigned to the Product Owner while the Tasks are assigned to the developer who will implement them. If the developer puts the "assigned to me" filter on, he cannot see the parent task it belongs to. It would be nice if showing the parent for displayed subtasks was at least an option in the config.
fields.summary: Task Board: in Outline view, show parent for displayed subtasks regardless of context filter

fields.description:
This appears to have been reported before (see, GHS-622), but we are observing it with Greenhopper 3.3 on Jira 3.13 and have verified it on the [public Atlassian jira site|http://jira.atlassian.com]

Observed behavior is that the first priority in the list is selected by default when creating an issue or subtask using quick card creation in the planning or task board. The first priority in the list is not defined as the default value in the system.

With the standard default Atlassian configuration, this means that "Major" is defined to be the default priority and "Blocked" is initially selected. (In our case, we have renamed these simply to "3" and "1".)
fields.summary: Quick card creation should default to the system default priority

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Initially raised in the forums [here|http://www.greenpeppersoftware.com/site/posts/list/424.page] but no response was received.

{quote}
Hi, 

I have an issue that has a resolution of Fixed while in the IN PROGRESS column. I have a transition from it's current status to a status that is mapped to the DONE column. I have the TASK BOARD mapping configured such that DONE is for issues in status Done and any resolution EXCEPT None. 

When I drag the issue from IN PROGRESS to DONE GH says the workflow doesn't allow the transition. However it CAN be done in JIRA. 

If I change the TASK BOARD mapping such that I allow "with one of the selected resolutions" and select all the resolutions including None then GH lets me do the drag. 

Weird. 

I checked for bugs affecting GH 3.0.1 in GreenPepper JIRA but didn't find anything. I also looked at all bugs fixed since 3.0.1 for the TASK BOARD component and didn't find anything. 

Have I stumbled upon a new bug? {quote}
fields.summary: GH says transition is not allowed but it works in JIRA

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: At present, we're using Versions for our Software Versions (e.g. 0.9.0) and Sprints (e.g. Sprint 1) and then use the hierarchy to set Parents to Children e.g. Version 0.9.0 includes Sprint 1, Sprint 2 and Sprint 3.  Is it possible to have a seperate 'version' just for Sprints?  Then use the drop down list in the Planning Board (right hand column above 'versioning boxes') to display Sprints alongside Versions, Components etc.
fields.summary: Add a separate field to allow tracking sprint and release information independent of one another

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

One of our users reported a bug to me and I have reproduced it in GH 3.0.1 and GH 3.4-EAP-jira39 (on the greenpeppersoftware.com website).

Recipe:

# Browse to TASK BOARD
# Switch to Outline view
# Set # parents to 1
# Browse to the last page of issues
# Set # parents to number of pages + 1

Now the paging links disappear but the view doesn't show any more issues than it did before.

Cheers,

Ximon
fields.summary: Changing # parents on TASK BOARD can get you "stuck"

fields.summary: [TRADUCTION FR] Dans la configuration des colonnes du taskboard

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We will have hundreds of projects but at that scale the project list drop-down will be difficult to use.  Anything over 10 items in a drop-down starts to get unfriendly.  Is there a different UI widget that could be used to navigate to a different project?  I suggest having an option to replace the drop-down list with a Switch Project "button".  When pressed you could do a DIV overlay that pulls in the project names in any number of ways.  An Ajax search or category filter could even be used to limit your choices. 

Note that I'm not suggesting multiple projects as other requests have.  I just need a better way of selecting a single project.

We could filter the list using permissions but we would prefer that everyone have at least read-only access to all projects by default.
fields.summary: Many projects make the project list difficult to use

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be great to be able to easily print the planning board.

Currently it tends to break cards over page breaks.

The idea being is we want to print out all our cards and stick them on the wall for a meeting. 

Implementation Ideas
* PDF it 
* Using http://davidwalsh.name/css-page-breaks CSS Page breaks to do something sensible e.g. break per row of cards (I know will waste a lot of paper). 
* Try CSS avoid page break (I am not sure how many browsers actually support this) http://www.w3schools.com/CSS/pr_print_pageba.asp
fields.summary: Print the planning board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Environment :
Green Hopper 3.1.1
JIRA Enterprise 3.1.3

We are getting the following errors:
I have gone though similar request  GHS-808.It says the issue is resolved in 3.2.
Please confirm that these issues are green hopper related  or not?so that we stop investigating on the other plug-ins for the issues and install the latest  version of green hopper.

fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to be redirected on my issue when closing the JIRAIFrame

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Status Comparator used by GreenHopper is based on the sequence of the status.
Now mulitple statuses may have the same sequence number if they are in different workflows thus they are the "duplicated status" based on the sequence is not add to the statuses list.

We need to reuse the Status Comparator that JIRA provides.

Unfortunately there is no workaround.
fields.summary: If my project has multiple workflows we are missing some statuses in the TaskBoard Configuration
